uploadThan.message: The file uploaded by a student cannot exceed 300 MB!

scoreProfile.message: Students practice pronunciation by reading words/sentences aloud. The system compares the pronunciation with the words/sentences and automatically grades the pronunciation, freeing teachers from reviewing/grading it manually. After the system's grading, teachers can also make manual changes.

scoreDesc.message: Due to technical limitations, the system grading function currently only supports grading for reading aloud within 200 words and audio within 2 minutes. Exceeding the limits will result in grading failure! When you fill in the reading content, do not exceed 200 words.

gradeRule.message: Student’s assignment score = average score of all peer reviews  – number of the assignments to be peer-reviewed (by this student) x 5% x points possible of the assignment. For example: for the assignment with 100 points possible, if a student gets an average peer review score 80, but this student only peer-reviewed 1 out of 4 assignments assigned to him/her,  then 3 x 5% x 100 points will be deducted from his or final score. Therefore, the final assignment score for this the student will be: 80 - 3 x 5% x 100 = 65 points.

appealContent.message: Students can appeal to the teacher about the average score of the peer-review assignment. The teacher can change the average score of the peer-review assignment, but the points deducted due to the student's failing to completing the peer-reviews assigned to him or her will remain.

stuAppealContent.message: If students are not satisfied with the average score of the peer reviews, they can appeal to the teacher, and the teacher will grade the assignment. The final assignment score will be: the score graded by the teacher - number of the assignments to be peer-reviewed (by this student) x 5% x points possible of the assignment.

automaticText.message: This is an auto-graded assignment. You need to complete the read-aloud within 2 minutes. Otherwise, the system will fail to grade the assignment!

clickText.message: Click the recording button, and then click "Allow" in the pop-up window to turn on the microphone. Don’t forget to click the Submit Assignment button to submit this assignment after recording.

assignmentComText.message: After the assignment is completed, select a representative to submit an assignment - other students do not need to submit!

caseText.message: Before submitting, modifying and withdrawing assignments, please obtain the consent of other members. Don’t modify or delete assignments just by your own will, because all members’ assignment scores will be affected.

allowedText.message: Pasting is disabled - please enter manually!

teamMemberText.message: Every member will share the same score after the group assignment is graded. Make sure that your submission is approved by other team members.

determinaWorkText.message: Are you sure you want to withdraw this assignment? Make sure you have the consent of all other members.
